thread.title: 10 Unassuming Restaurants In South Dakota That Secretly Serve The State's Best Donuts
thread.title_full: 10 Unassuming Restaurants In South Dakota That Secretly Serve The State's Best Donuts

author: Christopher Wagner
title: 10 Unassuming Restaurants In South Dakota That Secretly Serve The State's Best Donuts
text:
Craving incredible donuts hiding in unexpected South Dakota restaurants?
These 10 surprising spots offer mouthwatering pastries and welcoming atmospheres that locals treasure!
1. Mr. Donuts (Sioux Falls)
Walk into Mr. Donuts and your nose will thank you immediately.
The smell of fresh donuts frying is better than any fancy perfume in the world.
This place is a riot of color with its bright blue, yellow, and red exterior that stands out like a happy little beacon.
Their cake donuts have that perfect crispy outside and tender inside that’s so hard to find these days.
The cream-filled long johns are stuffed so generously you’ll need extra napkins – consider yourself warned!
Chocolate lovers will go nuts for their chocolate frosted donuts with sprinkles that taste like they were made by donut angels.
The shop isn’t fancy, but that’s part of its charm.
You’re here for the donuts, not for Instagram photos (though your friends will be jealous when they see what you’re eating).
Morning crowds can get busy with locals grabbing boxes for their offices.
Be a hero and bring a dozen to your next meeting – you’ll be everyone’s favorite person.
Where: 1010 E 10th St, Sioux Falls, SD 57103
2. Jerry’s Cakes & Donuts (Rapid City)
You haven’t lived until you’ve tried a donut from Jerry’s.
This unassuming shop with its “Simply Legendary” sign isn’t kidding around.
The display case is like a treasure chest of sugary delights that will make your eyes pop and your mouth water.
Their glazed donuts are so light and fluffy, they practically float off the plate.
The apple fritters are the size of your face – and that’s not an exaggeration!
Each bite is packed with cinnamon-apple goodness that will make you forget all your troubles.
The maple bars?
Oh my goodness, they’re the stuff dreams are made of.
Locals line up early because once they’re sold out, that’s it for the day!
The coffee is hot, strong, and the perfect companion to whatever sweet treat you choose.
It’s the kind of place where the staff might remember your name after just a couple visits.
Where: 109 E Omaha St, Rapid City, SD 57701
3. Flyboy Donuts (Sioux Falls)
Flyboy Donuts soars above the competition with its aviation theme and out-of-this-world treats.
The moment you spot that winged donut logo, you know you’re in for something special.
Their signature maple bacon donut should be illegal – it’s that good.
Sweet maple glaze topped with crispy bacon creates a flavor explosion that will make you question everything you thought you knew about donuts.
The shop is clean and welcoming with plenty of seating if you want to stay awhile.
Kids go crazy for their colorful sprinkle donuts that look like little party hats.
Coffee snobs, rejoice!
Their coffee selection is impressive and pairs perfectly with their sweet offerings.
The staff moves quickly even during the morning rush, so don’t worry about long waits.
Seasonal flavors keep things interesting throughout the year – their pumpkin spice in fall is worth marking your calendar for.
Locals whisper that their apple fritters might actually be magic in disguise.
Where: 5005 S Western Ave Unit 190, Sioux Falls, SD 57108
4. Daylight Donuts of Rapid City (Rapid City)
Daylight Donuts proves that sometimes the simplest places make the most extraordinary treats.
The cheerful sun logo welcomes you to this no-frills shop that focuses on what matters: amazing donuts.
Their glazed donuts have that perfect sheen that crackles slightly when you take your first bite.
The inside is so soft and airy, it’s like biting into a sweet cloud.
Chocolate lovers will fall head over heels for their chocolate iced donuts with that rich, never-too-sweet frosting.
The shop itself is humble – a simple building with a straightforward mission to make your day better.
Early birds get the best selection, but it’s worth setting your alarm for.
Their donut holes are dangerously poppable – you’ll start with “just one” and suddenly the bag is empty.
The friendly staff works with lightning speed during the morning rush.
Locals know to grab an extra dozen for the freezer – they thaw beautifully for late-night cravings!
Where: 1302 E Saint Patrick St, Rapid City, SD 57701
5. Zebra King Donuts (Centerville)
In tiny Centerville, Zebra King Donuts stands as proof that big flavors can come from small towns.
The classic brick storefront with its bold sign has been drawing donut pilgrims for years.
Their signature zebra donut with chocolate and vanilla stripes isn’t just pretty – it’s a taste sensation.
The raised donuts are so light and airy, they practically melt in your mouth.
Walking in feels like stepping back in time to when things were simpler and sweeter.
The old-school vibe with wooden benches outside makes for a perfect spot to enjoy your treats.
Locals swear their buttermilk cake donuts are the best cure for a bad day.
The apple fritters are chunky with real apple pieces and a glaze that crackles with each bite.

Don’t be surprised if strangers strike up conversations while you wait – that’s just the Centerville way.
This place proves you don’t need fancy equipment or trendy flavors to make donut magic.
Where: 516 Broadway St, Centerville, SD 57014
6. Pierre Donut Shop (Pierre)
The Pierre Donut Shop might look like a spaceship landed in the capital city with its unique angular roof.
This quirky little building houses some of the most consistently delicious donuts in the state.
Their old-fashioned sour cream donuts have that perfect crispy exterior that donut dreams are made of.
The inside stays tender and cake-like, creating a texture contrast that’s simply perfect.
Jelly-filled donuts are stuffed so generously that taking a bite is a delightfully dangerous game.
The shop is no-frills in the best possible way – they put all their energy into the donuts, not the decor.
Early morning visitors might catch the heavenly scent of fresh donuts being made.
Locals know to come early because when they’re out, they’re out!
The friendly service makes you feel like you’re visiting a neighbor rather than a business.
Their chocolate frosted donuts with that slightly crackly top are worth setting your alarm for.
Where: 1120 N Euclid Ave, Pierre, SD 57501
7. Delight Donut (Yankton)
Delight Donut in Yankton lives up to its name with every single bite.
The simple storefront with its big blue sign doesn’t need fancy frills – the donuts speak for themselves.
Their glazed donuts have that perfect sweet coating that crackles just right when you take a bite.
The raised donuts are so fluffy they practically float off the plate.
Apple fritters here are the size of small dinner plates and loaded with cinnamon-spiced apple chunks.
The shop has that comfortable, lived-in feel that makes you want to linger over coffee.
Locals start their day here, trading news and enjoying fresh donuts still warm from the fryer.
Their cake donuts have that ideal density – not too heavy, not too light, just perfectly satisfying.
The maple long johns are finger-licking good with maple frosting that tastes like it came straight from Vermont.
Don’t miss their cream-filled bismarcks – they’re generously stuffed and dusted with powdered sugar.
Where: 1512 Broadway Ave, Yankton, SD 57078
8. Flandreau Bakery (Flandreau)
Flandreau Bakery might not look fancy from the outside, but inside is a wonderland of freshly baked goodness.
The mint green storefront in downtown Flandreau houses some serious baking talent.
Their donuts are old-school perfection – no crazy flavors needed when the basics are done this well.
The glazed donuts have that perfect sweet coating that melts in your mouth.
Their cake donuts have an almost crispy exterior that gives way to a tender, flavorful interior.
The bakery smells like heaven itself – butter, sugar, and yeast working their magic together.
Locals gather here not just for donuts but for the sense of community that fills the space.
Their cinnamon rolls are the size of softballs and dripping with icing that will make you weak in the knees.
The coffee is always hot and fresh – the perfect partner to whatever sweet treat you choose.
This place is proof that sometimes the best things haven’t changed much in decades.
Where: 105 E 2nd Ave, Flandreau, SD 57028
9. That Place in Lead (Lead)
With a name like “That Place in Lead,” you know you’re in for something special.
The rustic wooden exterior with stone accents fits perfectly in this historic Black Hills town.
Inside, the aroma of fresh donuts and espresso creates an irresistible welcome.
Their donuts aren’t just breakfast – they’re works of art that happen to be delicious.
The maple bacon donut will change your life with its perfect sweet-savory balance.
Their raised donuts are so light and airy, they practically float off the plate.
The shop has that cozy mountain town vibe that makes you want to settle in with a book.
Locals and tourists alike line up for these handcrafted treats that put chain donuts to shame.
Their apple fritters are packed with chunks of real apple and a hint of cinnamon that’s just right.
The friendly staff treats everyone like old friends, even if it’s your first visit.
Where: 501 W Main St, Lead, SD 57754
10. 8th Avenue Bakery (Belle Fourche)
8th Avenue Bakery’s charming brick building has been satisfying sweet tooths in Belle Fourche for years.
The classic bakery with its glass block windows looks like it belongs in a movie about small-town America.
Their donuts are the definition of homemade goodness – no mass production shortcuts here.
The glazed donuts have that perfect sweet coating that shatters slightly when you take a bite.
Their cake donuts have a density that feels substantial without being heavy – the perfect texture.
Early birds catch the donuts still warm from the fryer – an experience that’s worth setting an alarm for.
The bakery has that wonderful mix of flour, sugar, and butter in the air that feels like a hug.
Locals stop in not just for donuts but for the friendly conversation that comes free with every purchase.
Their cinnamon sugar donuts are simple perfection – sometimes the classics are all you need.
The coffee is strong and hot – the ideal companion to whatever sweet treat you choose.
Where: 704 8th Ave, Belle Fourche, SD 57717
South Dakota’s restaurant scene hides sweet surprises in unexpected places!
These unassuming spots might not look fancy, but they’re serving up donut magic that will have you coming back for seconds!
